titlestmt.titleproper: Sir Joseph Gold literary manuscript collection 1904-1972
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Sir Joseph Gold literary manuscript collection
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: London-born and educated, Sir Joseph Gold was a noted scholar of international monetary law and a renowned collector of first editions of contemporary authors.

scopecontent.p: The Sir Joseph Gold literary manuscript collection consists of twentieth-century British and American literary manuscripts and papers, including letters, poems, translations, reviews, essays, and other material. Authors in the collection include Barry MacSweeney, Tom Pickard, John Wieners, Brian Patton, Ralph Maud, Theodore Roethke, Martin Bell, Donald Justice, Anthony Hecht, Philip Whalen, Clayton Eshleman, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Tony Connor, Charles Causley, Bertrand Russell, Charles Osborne, Allen Ginsberg, Samuel Beckett, Peter Russell, Olga Rudge, and others.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
